In the short vowels beginning with a, these are in order. Here, anusvara is also added, and eight is stated.

translated: Thus, the nature of the subsequent letters as consisting of the rays of Soma and their qualities are stated by dravatā etc. And in the Jaya (Tantra) it is said: Dravatā (fluidity), śaityabhāva (coldness), tṛpti (satisfaction), kānti (lustre), prasannatā (clarity), rasata (taste), svāda (enjoyment), and ānanda (bliss) - these eight are considered lunar. original: utpattikrame dhvanilakṣaṇaḥ / apyayakrame parārūpeṇa cillakṣaṇaḥ / akāramārabhya sakāraparyantaṃ gaṇane aṣṭacatvāriṃśat varṇā bhavanti / yathā svarāḥ ṣoḍaśa sparśāḥ pañcaviṃśatiḥ antaḥsthāścatvāraḥ hakāraṃ vihāyoṣmāṇastraya iti / evaṃ hakāramārabhya dīrghākāraparyantagaṇane'pi /

translated: In the order of manifestation, it is characterized by sound. In the order of dissolution, it is characterized by consciousness in the form of the Supreme. In the enumeration starting from the letter a up to the letter sa, there are forty-eight letters. As the vowels are sixteen, the consonants are twenty-five, the semi-vowels are four excluding the letter h, and the sibilants are three. In the same way, in the enumeration starting from the letter h up to the long vowel a.

original: caturātmanāṃ vāsudevādīnāṃ prabhave hakāro dvādaśānto bhavati / apyaye tu akārastathā / ayaṃ bhāvaḥ pūrvoktāṣṭacatvāriṃśadvarṇānāṃ dvādaśadhā vibhāge prativibhāgaṃ catvāro varṇāḥ saṃpadyante / ete ca krameṇa vāsudevādibhiścaturbhiradhiṣṭhitā bhavanti / dvādaśabhāgānte prabhave hakāraḥ laye akāraśca bhavata iti /
analyzed: catur ātmanām vāsudeva ādīnām prabhave hakāraḥ dvādaśa antaḥ bhavati apyaye tu akāraḥ tathā ayam bhāvaḥ pūrva ukta aṣṭacatvāriṃśat varṇānām dvādaśadhā vibhāge prativibhāgam catvāraḥ varṇāḥ saṃpadyante ete ca krameṇa vāsudeva ādibhiḥ caturbhiḥ adhiṣṭhitāḥ bhavanti dvādaśa bhāga ante prabhave hakāraḥ laye akāraḥ ca bhavataḥ iti
translated: The letter h is at the end of the twelve in the manifestation of Vāsudeva and others, but in dissolution, it is the letter a. The meaning is this: When the aforementioned forty-eight letters are divided into twelve parts, there are four letters in each part. And these are respectively presided over by the four, Vāsudeva and others. At the end of the twelve parts, the letter h is in manifestation, and the letter a is in dissolution.

analyzed: prativibhāgam āsthitāḥ vāsudeva ādayaḥ krameṇa viśrāma udaya vyāpti vyakti rūpāḥ jñeyāḥ
translated: The Vāsudevas etc. residing in each part should be known to be in the form of rest, origin, pervasion, and manifestation respectively.

translated: Three - although four mantras will be mentioned, still, taking some difference among them, the three are separately indicated.

original: mantrasvarūpāṇyāha viṣṇave ityādi / ādau namo bhagavate iti / ante vāsudevāyeti / namo bhagavate vāsudevāyeti mantra ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: mantra svarūpāṇi āha viṣṇave ityādi ādau namaḥ bhagavate iti ante vāsudevāya iti namaḥ bhagavate vāsudevāya iti mantraḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The forms of the mantras are stated beginning with to Vishnu. At the beginning, salutations to the Blessed Lord. At the end, to Vāsudeva. The meaning is that the mantra is salutations to the Blessed Lord Vāsudeva.

analyzed: p mūla
translated: The root

analyzed: jitam te puṇḍarīkākṣa namaḥ te viśvabhāvana
translated: O Pundarikaksha, you are victorious. Salutations to you, O creator of the universe.

analyzed: namaḥ te tu hṛṣīkeśa mahāpuruṣa pūrvaja
translated: Salutations to you, O Hrishikesha, O great being, O primordial one.

analyzed: pada mantraḥ caturthaḥ yam praṇavasya puraṃdaraḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: This fourth pada mantra, O Purandara, is proclaimed as preceded by Om.

original: oṃkārasahitānetān mantrān pūrvavido viduḥ // //🔽jñānādiguṇasaṃyuktairakṣaraiḥ praṇavādibhiḥ ī / praṇavādikaiḥ /
analyzed: oṃkāra sahitān etān mantrān pūrvavidaḥ viduḥ  jñāna ādi guṇa saṃyuktaiḥ akṣaraiḥ praṇava ādibhiḥ praṇava ādikaiḥ
translated: Those who know the Vedas consider these mantras to be accompanied by Om.🔽With syllables endowed with qualities such as knowledge, beginning with Om,

analyzed: namaḥ ntaiḥ aga kḷptiḥ syāt tathā eva upāṅga kalpanā
translated: Salutations and other syllables should be arranged, and likewise the subsidiary arrangements should be made.

analyzed: nyūna akṣarasya mantrasya varṇena carameṇa tu
translated: For a mantra with fewer syllables, the last syllable

original: upāṅgakalpanā kāryā tattadguṇapadairyutā B / F / tattatpadaguṇaiḥ // //🔽tathaiva ī / tathaivādhika sphītavarṇasya śiṣṭaistu dvādaśādhikaiḥ /
analyzed: upāṅga kalpanā kāryā tad tad guṇa pada yuta  sphīta varṇasya śiṣṭaiḥ tu dvādaśa adhikaiḥ
translated: should be used for the subsidiary arrangement, along with words expressing those qualities.🔽Likewise, for a mantra with more syllables, the last syllable

analyzed: samastaiḥ carama upāṅgam kalpayet tejasā saha
translated: should be used for the subsidiary arrangement, along with the remaining twelve syllables, along with brilliance.

analyzed: kevalaḥ tārakaḥ ca eva catvāraḥ ca tad ādikāḥ
translated: Kevala, Tāraka, and the four beginning with that,

analyzed: pañca ete vyāpakāḥ mantrāḥ pāñcarātre prakīrtitāḥ
translated: these five all-pervading mantras are proclaimed in the Pañcarātra.

original: nāsādhyaṃ kiṃcidastīha ī / nānāsādyaṃ kiṃcidasti mantrairebhirmahātmabhiḥ /
analyzed: na asādhyam kiṃcid asti iha ī na anāsādyam kiṃcid asti mantraiḥ ebhiḥ mahātmabhiḥ
translated: There is nothing unattainable here, nothing unobtainable with these great mantras.

original: niśreṇī pañcaparvaiṣā parabrahmādhirogaṇe // //🔽eṣā divyā mahāsattā pañcamantrī tu manmayī /
analyzed: niśreṇī pañca parvā eṣā para brahma adhirogaṇe  eṣā divyā mahāsattā pañca mantrī tu mad mayī
translated: This five-limbed ladder ascends to the highest Brahman.

original: arcanājjapato dhyānādimāṃ ḍ / F / amuṃ samyak samāśritaḥ /
analyzed: arcanāt japataḥ dhyānāt imām a mum samyak samāśritaḥ
translated: This is the divine great existence, consisting of the five mantras, full of me.🔽By worshipping, repeating, meditating on this, properly resorting to this,

original: svāṃ sattāṃ vaiṣṇavīṃ prāpya paraṃ brahmādhigacchati // //
analyzed: svām sattām vaiṣṇavīm prāpya param brahma adhigacchati
translated: attaining one's own existence, the Vaishnava, one attains the highest Brahman.

original: iti śrīpāñcarātrasāre ā / śrīpañcarātra / B / śrīpāñcarātre lakṣmītantre tāraprakāśo ī / tāraka nāma caturviṃśo'dhyāyaḥ //🔽ṭippaṇī 🔽nyūnākṣarasyeti / ṣaḍakṣarāṣṭākṣaramantrayoḥ nyūnākṣaratvam / tatra caramākṣareṇa pūraṇaṃ kartavyamityarthaḥ /🔽sphītavarṇasyeti / adhikavarṇasyetyarthaḥ yathā jitaṃ te iti mantre /🔽iti caturviṃśo'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī pāñcarātrasāre śrīpañcarātra śrīpāñcarātre lakṣmītantre tāraprakāśaḥ tāraka nāma caturviṃśaḥ adhyāyaḥ 🔽ṭippaṇī 🔽nyūna akṣarasya iti ṣaṣ akṣara aṣṭa akṣara mantrayoḥ nyūna akṣara tvam tatra carama akṣareṇa pūraṇam kartavyam iti arthaḥ 🔽sphīta varṇasya iti adhika varṇasya iti arthaḥ yathā jitam te iti mantre 🔽iti caturviṃśaḥ udhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-fourth chapter named Tāraka in the Lakṣmī Tantra of the Śrī Pañcarātra in the Śrī Pañcarātra Sāra.

analyzed: pañcaviṃśaḥ udhyāyaḥ
translated: Chapter 25

analyzed: śrīḥ śrīḥ uvāca
translated: Shri said:

original: itthaṃ te kathitaḥ śakra tārakasyaiṣa vistaraḥ /
analyzed: ittham te kathitaḥ śakra tārakasya eṣa vistaraḥ
translated: Thus, O Shakra, this account of Taraka has been told to you.

analyzed: saṃsāra tārikāyāḥ me tārikāyāḥ śṛṇu kramam
translated: Listen to the procedure of my Tarikā, which liberates from the worldly existence.

original: varṇānāṃ vidhisiddhyarthaṃ B / E / siddhi saṃjñāḥ pūrvaṃ niśāmaya /
analyzed: varṇānām vidhi siddhi artham b e siddhi saṃjñāḥ pūrvam niśāmaya
translated: For the accomplishment of the rules of the letters, first listen to the accomplishments known as B, E, S, I, D, D, H, I.

original: śrutāsu vidhivadyāsu vidhirmāntraḥ ā / B / C / ī / mantraḥ pravartate // //
analyzed: śrutāsu vidhivat yāsu vidhiḥ māntraḥ ā mantraḥ pravartate
translated: When the rules are heard properly, the mantra rule begins.

analyzed: akāraḥ ca aprameyaḥ ca prathamaḥ vyāpakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The letter A and the immeasurable one are remembered as the first and all-pervading.

analyzed: ādidevaḥ tathā ākāraḥ ānandaḥ gopanaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The letter Ā is the primordial god, and Ānanda is remembered as the concealer.

analyzed: rāma saṃjñaḥ ikāraḥ ca iddhaḥ iṣṭaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter I is known as Rāma, and the letter Ī is declared to be the illuminator and the desired one.

analyzed: īkāraḥ pañca binduḥ vai viṣṇuḥ māyā puraṃdara
translated: The letter Ū is the five-peaked one, and Viṣṇu, Māyā, and Purandara are the same.

analyzed: ukāraḥ bhuvana ākhyaḥ ca uddāmaḥ udayaḥ tathā
translated: The letter U is known as the world, and Uddāma and Udaya are the same.

original: ūkāra ūrjo lokeśaḥ prajñādhārākhya eva ca // //
analyzed: ūkāraḥ ūrjaḥ lokeśaḥ prajñādhāra ākhyaḥ eva ca
translated: The letter Ū is Ūrja, the lord of the world, and is known as Prajñādhāra.

original: satyaśca ṛtadhāmā ca ṛkāraḥ sa tu cāṅkuśaḥ /
analyzed: satyaḥ ca ṛtadhāmā ca ṛkāraḥ sa tu ca aṅkuśaḥ
translated: The letter Ṛ is truth, the abode of truth, and is the goad.

analyzed: ṛkāraḥ viṣṭara ākhyaḥ ca jvālā ca eva prasāraṇam
translated: The letter Ṛ is known as Viṣṭara, and the letter Ṛ is the flame and the spreading out.

analyzed: liṅga ātmā bhagavān ḷkāraḥ tārakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The letter Ḷ is said to be the soul of the linga, and the letter Ḷ is remembered as the savior.

original: ḹkāro dīrghaghoṇaśca ā / koṇaśca devadattastathā ī / sthiro virāṭ // //
analyzed: ḍāraḥ dīrgha ghoṇaḥ ca ā koṇaḥ ca devadattaḥ tathā sthiraḥ virāj
translated: The long-nosed one is A. The corner and Devadatta are E. The stable one is Virata.

analyzed: tri asraḥ ekāra saṃjñaḥ ca jagat yoniḥ avigrahaḥ
translated: The triangle is known as E. The source of the universe is formless.

original: aiśvaryaṃ yogadhātā ā / B / C / dātā ca ai sa airāvaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ // //
analyzed: aiśvaryam yoga dhātā ā b dātā ca sa airāvaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The lord of wealth is A. The creator of yoga is B. The giver is C. The one with Airavata is remembered as A.

original: okāra otadehaśca C / ḍ / ṅ / devaśca odanaścaiva vikramī /
analyzed: okāraḥ otadehaḥ ca devaḥ ca odanaḥ ca eva vikramī
translated: The syllable O is the one with a body that is woven. The god of the syllable C, D, and N is Odanaka, the valorous one.

original: aurvo'tha bhūdharākhyaśca au smṛto hyauṣadhātmakaḥ // //🔽trailokyaiśvaryadau vyāpī vyomeśoṃ'kāra eva ca /
analyzed: aurvaḥ atha bhūdhara ākhyaḥ ca smṛtaḥ hi auṣadha ātmakaḥ  trailokya aiśvarya dau vyāpī vyomeśa oṃkāraḥ eva ca
translated: The one named Aurva and the one named Bhu are remembered as Au, which is of the nature of medicine.🔽The one who grants the lordship of the three worlds is pervasive, the lord of the sky, and the syllable A.

analyzed: visargaḥ sṛṣṭi kṛt khyātaḥ hyaḥkāraḥ parameśvaraḥ
translated: The emission is known as the creator of emanation. The syllable H is the supreme lord.

original: kamalaśca B / kapilaśca / ḍ / amalaśca karālaśca kakāraḥ prakṛtiḥ parā /
analyzed: kamalaḥ ca b kapilaḥ ca amalaḥ ca karālaḥ ca kakāraḥ prakṛtiḥ parā
translated: The lotus and the tawny one are B. The pure one and the fierce one are K. The syllable K is the supreme nature.

analyzed: khakāraḥ kharva dehaḥ ca veda ātmā viśva bhāvanaḥ
translated: The syllable K is the one with a body that is dwarfish. The soul of the Vedas is the creator of the universe.

original: gadadhvaṃsī ā / B / F / gata gakārastu govindaśca gadādharaḥ /
analyzed: gadadhvaṃsī ā b gata gakāraḥ tu govindaḥ ca gadādharaḥ
translated: The one with the club and the conch is A. The syllable G is Govinda and the wielder of the club.

analyzed: ghakāraḥ tu atha dharmāṃśuḥ tejasvī dīptimān tathā
translated: The syllable G is the one with Dharma's rays, the radiant one, and the brilliant one.

analyzed: ṅakāraḥ eka daṃṣṭra ākhyaḥ bhūtātmā bhūtabhāvanaḥ
translated: The one named Ekadanta is the soul of beings and the creator of beings.

original: cakāraścañcalaścakrī ā / ḍ / cakraḥ candrāṃśuḥ sa tu kathyate // //
analyzed: cakāraḥ cañcalaḥ cakrī cakraḥ candrāṃśuḥ sa tu kathyate
translated: The letter Ca is the fickle Cakrī, the letter Ḍa is the Cakra, and it is said to be the moonbeam.

original: chandaḥpatiśchaladhvaṃsī B / baladhvaṃsī chakāraśchanda eva ca /
analyzed: chandaḥpatiḥ chaladhvaṃsī baladhvaṃsī chakāraḥ chandaḥ eva ca
translated: The letter Bha is the lord of meters, the destroyer of deceit, the destroyer of strength, the letter Bha, and also the meter.

original: janmahantājitaścaiva jakāraścaiva śāśvataḥ // //🔽jhakāro jhaṣasaṃjñaśca sāmagaḥ sāmapāṭhakaḥ /
analyzed: janma hantā ajitaḥ ca eva jakāraḥ ca eva śāśvataḥ  jhakāraḥ jhaṣa saṃjñaḥ ca sāma gaḥ sāma pāṭhakaḥ
translated: The letter Ja is the destroyer of birth, the unconquered, and also the eternal letter Ja.🔽The letter Ṇha is known as the fish, the chanter of Sāman, the reciter of Sāman,

analyzed: īśvaraḥ ca uttama ākhyaḥ ca ñakāraḥ tattva dhārakaḥ
translated: The letter Ṇa is the lord, the one called excellent, the bearer of reality.🔽The letter Ṭa is the moon, the delighter, and the one who nourishes the universe.

original: dhārādharaṣṭhakāraśca nemiḥ kaustubha ucyate // //🔽daṇḍadhāro ḍakāraśca mausalo'khaṇḍavikramaḥ /
analyzed: dhārādharaḥ ṭhakāraḥ ca nemiḥ kaustubhaḥ ucyate  / daṇḍadhāraḥ ḍakāraḥ ca mausala ukhaṇḍa vikramaḥ
translated: The letter Ḍha is the cloud, the rim, and is said to be the Kaustubha jewel.🔽The letter Ḍa is the wielder of the staff, the one with the mace, and of unbroken valor.

analyzed: ḍhakāraḥ viśvarūpaḥ ca vṛṣakarmā pratardanaḥ
translated: The letter Ḍha is of universal form, the one with the deed of a bull, and Pratardana.

original: ṇakāro'bhayadaḥ śāstā vaikuṇṭha iti B / C / F / ī / vaikuṇṭhaḥ pari kīrtitaḥ /🔽takārastālalakṣmā ḍ / omits lines from here ca vairājaḥ sragdharaḥ smṛtaḥ // //
analyzed: ṇakāra ubhaya daḥ śāstā vaikuṇṭhaḥ iti vaikuṇṭhaḥ kīrtitaḥ  takāraḥ tāla lakṣmā omits lines from here ca vairājaḥ sragdharaḥ smṛtaḥ  /
translated: The letter Ṇa is the giver of fearlessness, the teacher, and is said to be Vaikuṇṭha.🔽The letter Ṭa is the one with the mark of a palm tree, and the letter Ḍha is remembered as the one wearing a garland of Virāṭ.

original: dhanvī B / and C / omit lines from here bhuvanapālaśca thakāraḥ sarvarodhakaḥ /
analyzed: dhanvī b and c omit lines from here bhuvanapālaḥ ca thakāraḥ sarva rodhakaḥ
translated: The letter Ḍha is the archer, the protector of the world, and the one who obstructs everything.
The letter Da, which grants permission, is known to bestow peace.

analyzed: dhakāraḥ śārṅgadhṛt dhartā mādhavaḥ ca prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter Dha is proclaimed to be the holder of the Sharnga bow, and Madhava.

original: naro nārāyaṇaḥ panthā nakāraḥ samudāhṛtaḥ // //🔽pakāraḥ padmanābhaśca pavitraḥ paścimānanaḥ /
analyzed: naraḥ nārāyaṇaḥ panthāḥ nakāraḥ samudāhṛtaḥ  pakāraḥ padmanābhaḥ ca pavitraḥ paścimānanaḥ
translated: The letter Na is declared to be Nara, Narayana, and the path.🔽The letter Pa is Padma-nabh (lotus navel), the sacred one, and the one with the western face.

original: phakāraḥ phullanayano lāṅgalī śvetasaṃjñitaḥ B / C / F / ī / saṃjñakaḥ // //
analyzed: phakāraḥ phulla nayanaḥ lāṅgalī śveta saṃjñitaḥ b c f ī saṃjñakaḥ
translated: The letter Pha is the one with blooming eyes, the plough-bearer, and is known as the white one.

original: bakāro vāmano hrasvaḥ pūrṇāṅgaḥ sa ca kathyate /
analyzed: bakāraḥ vāmanaḥ hrasvaḥ pūrṇa aṅgaḥ sa ca kathyate
translated: The letter Ba is said to be Vamana, the short one, and the one with a complete body.

original: bhallātako B / C / E / bhallāṭakaḥ bhakāraśca jñeyaḥ siddhiprado dhruvaḥ // //
analyzed: bhallātakaḥ b bhallāṭakaḥ bhakāraḥ ca jñeyaḥ siddhipradaḥ dhruvaḥ
translated: The letter Bha is known to be the one who grants accomplishment, the Bhallataka, and the Bhallataka.

analyzed: makāraḥ mardanaḥ kālaḥ pradhānaḥ paripaṭhyate
translated: The letter Ma is said to be the one who crushes, time, and the principal one.

analyzed: catur gatiḥ yakāraḥ ca su sūkṣmaḥ śaṅkhaḥ ucyate  /
translated: The letter Ya is said to be the one with four paths, the extremely subtle one, and the conch.
The letter Ra is the support of all worlds, fire, and the fire of time.

analyzed: lakāraḥ vibudha ākhyaḥ ca dhareśaḥ puruṣeśvaraḥ
translated: The letter La is known as the god, the lord of the earth, and the lord of beings.

analyzed: varāhaḥ ca amṛtādhāraḥ vakāraḥ varuṇaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The letter Va is remembered as Varaha, the support of nectar, and Varuna.
The letter Sha is proclaimed to be Shankara, the peaceful one, and the lotus-eyed one.

original: nṛsiṃhaścāgnirūpaśca omits from here ṣakāro bhāskarastathā /
analyzed: nṛsiṃhaḥ ca agni rūpaḥ ca omits line from here ṣakāraḥ bhāskaraḥ tathā
translated: Nṛsiṃha and the form of fire, the letter ṣa is the sun,

analyzed: sakāraḥ tu amṛtaḥ tṛptiḥ somaḥ ca parikīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter sa is declared to be immortality, satisfaction, and the moon.

original: sūryo ā / F / ṅ / sūro hakāraḥ prāṇastu paramātmā prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: sūryaḥ ā f ṅ sūraḥ hakāraḥ prāṇaḥ tu paramātmā prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The letter ha is the sun, the vital breath, and the supreme self is declared.

original: ananteśaḥ kṣakārastu vargānto garuḍastathā ā / ī / smṛtaḥ // //
analyzed: ananta īśaḥ kṣakāraḥ tu varga antaḥ garuḍaḥ tathā ī smṛtaḥ
translated: The letter kṣa is Ananteśa, the end of the group, and Garuḍa is remembered as the letter ā.

analyzed: aśeṣa saṃjñāḥ varṇānām iti etāḥ kīrtitāḥ mayā
translated: These are said to be the names of all the letters.

analyzed: anuloma vilomena varṇyāḥ varṇasya vai punar
translated: Again, the name of the letter should be pronounced in the reverse order of the forward and reverse sequences.

original: saṃjñā saṃkhyā ā / saṃkhyā saṃjñā ca yā śakra sāmānyā sā mahāmate /
analyzed: saṃjñā saṃkhyā ā saṃkhyā saṃjñā ca yā śakra sāmānyā sā mahāmate
translated: O Śakra, O greatly wise one, the number and name are the same in general.

analyzed: cit aṃśāḥ sarve eva ete varṇāḥ bhāsvara vigrahāḥ
translated: All these parts of consciousness, having radiant forms, are the letters.

analyzed: kāraṇam sarva mantrāṇām lakṣmī śakti upabṛṃhitāḥ
translated: They are the cause of all mantras, enhanced by the power of Lakṣmī.

original: stutāḥ saṃpūjitā dhyātā varṇāḥ ā / varṇasaṃjñābhiḥ saṃjñābhirādarāt // //
analyzed: stutāḥ saṃpūjitāḥ dhyātāḥ varṇāḥ ā varṇa saṃjñābhiḥ saṃjñābhiḥ ādarāt
translated: The letters, praised, worshipped, and meditated upon with respect using the names of the letters, bestow supreme prosperity and also cultivate knowledge.

analyzed: prayacchanti parāmṛddhim vijñānam bhāvayanti api
translated: They grant the highest prosperity and also cultivate knowledge.

original: parasparāṅgabhāvaṃ ca mantrotpattau vrajantyamī // //🔽carācare'smiṃstannāsti yadamībhirna bhāvitam /
analyzed: paraspara aṅga bhāvam ca mantra utpattau vrajanti amī 🔽carācare ismin tat nā asti yat amībhiḥ na bhāvitam
translated: These go to the origin of the mantra, having the nature of each other.🔽There is nothing in this moving and unmoving world that is not brought into being by these.

original: nityā yadyapi tā divyā mantrāṇāṃ mūrtayaḥ parāḥ // //
analyzed: nityāḥ yadi api tāḥ divyāḥ mantrāṇām mūrtayaḥ parāḥ
translated: Although those divine forms of the mantras are eternal,

original: tathāpyevaṃvidhairvarṇairbhāvitā iti cintanā C / cintanāḥ / ī / cintanāt /
analyzed: tathā api evaṃvidhaiḥ varṇaiḥ bhāvitāḥ iti cintanā cintanāḥ cintanāt
translated: nevertheless, they are contemplated as being infused with such and such letters. Contemplation is from contemplation.

analyzed: bhavanti pūrṇa sāmarthyāḥ mantrāḥ śāstra nidarśanāt
translated: The mantras become fully potent by the teaching of the scriptures.

original: ālambanaṃ dhiyāṃ caiva bhavantyevaṃ mahāmate /🔽abhāge'pi yathā vyomni dhiyā bhāgaḥ prakalpyate // //
analyzed: ālambanam dhiyām ca eva bhavanti evam mahāmate  a bhāge api yathā vyomni dhiyā bhāgaḥ prakalpyate
translated: And they become the support of the intellects, so it is, O greatly wise one.🔽Just as a part is imagined by the intellect in space, which is not divided,

analyzed: saukaryāya tathā mantre
translated: in the same way, for the sake of ease, the part of the letters in the mantra is contemplated.

original: kṛtvaiva bhāvagāṃ vyāptiṃ varṇānāṃ pūjanaṃ tridhā // //
analyzed: kṛtvā eva bhāva gām vyāptim varṇānām pūjanam tridhā
translated: Having made the pervasion of the letters into existence, the worship is threefold.

original: bhūmau padme tathā ḍ / F / athavā devyāstanau ī / tato mantrān samuddharet /

analyzed: madhyatas vartamānasya na eva anyat kṛtyam iti pūrveṇa anvayaḥ buddhi daurbalyāt iti sva adhikāram an ālocya duṣkare karmaṇi pravṛttiḥ hi buddhi daurbalya prayuktā iti bhāvaḥ upāya antaram atra bhakti yogaḥ anena bhakti yogasya nindā kriyate iti vā mumukṣoḥ bhakti yogaḥ svarūpa viruddhaḥ iti vā na mantavyam narasya buddhi daurbalyāt indu bimba grahe spṛhā iti ukte vacanam idam indu bimbam nindati iti na kaścid api prekṣāvān brūyāt kiṃca bhaktyā paramayā
translated: The one who is present in the middle has no other duty, as connected with the previous sentence. The meaning is that engaging in a difficult task without considering one's own duty is due to weakness of intellect. The alternative means here is devotion. It should not be thought that by this, devotion is being criticized, or that devotion is self-contradictory for one who desires liberation. When it is said, Due to the weakness of a man's intellect, he desires to grasp the moon's orb, no intelligent person would say that this statement criticizes the moon's orb. Moreover, it would contradict the statement that devotion is an optional means, saying By supreme devotion or by practice, O greatly wise one. If it is argued that it is self-contradictory for one who is unable and desires liberation, no one here has any disagreement.

translated: It is said that the meditation on Sudarshana is done after the Nyasa of the limbs. The meaning is that the Nyasa of the limbs is done. The Chakra Mudra is taught in this chapter itself, in the thirty-eighth verse, and the Vahni Prakara is taught in the thirty-seventh verse. The description of Sudarshana is given by the words Sahasra-aram etc. The meditation on the supreme Self in the form of a discus in the middle of the discus is begun by the words Akshastha etc. The weapons held in the right hand are mentioned by the words Chakra etc. The weapons held in the left hand are mentioned by the words Shankha etc. The meaning is that the right hand is powerful. The meditation on Sudarshana with eight arms is taught in detail in the forty-fourth chapter of the Ahirbudhnya Samhita and should be understood. The posture called Pratyalidha, which is the state of readiness for battle, is intended by the words Udyanjana.

original: pratyālīḍhākhyā sthitiḥ udyajjānumiti pūrvaṃ sūcitā / ṣoḍaśasu bhujeṣu dakṣiṇabhujāṣṭakāyudhānyāha śaktyetyādinā / vāmabhujāṣṭakāyudhānyāha śaṅkhenetyādinā / saṃsyūtatattvayeti / caturviṃśatitattvamayyetyarthaḥ / vanamālāsvarūpakathanametat / ata evāsyā bhūtamāletyapi vyavahāraḥ / adhvaṣaṭkaṃ varṇādhvādi /

translated: The posture called Pratyaliḍha, with the knee raised, was indicated earlier. Among the sixteen arms, the weapons of the eight right arms are mentioned starting with Shakti, and the weapons of the eight left arms are mentioned starting with Shankha. Sasyuta-tattva means consisting of the twenty-four principles. This describes the form of the garland of trees. For this very reason, it is also called Bhuta Mala. The six paths are the path of letters and so on.

analyzed: ā karṇāt nabhasaḥ sthānam ā vilāt ca api ahaṃkṛteḥ

analyzed: tatas prādeśa mātra agre mūrdhataḥ catur aṅgule

analyzed: sthāne prakṛtyāḥ śeṣam tat aṅgulīnām dvis aṣṭakam  /

analyzed: ekādaśyām dvi ṣaṭkāyām sthānam tattva akṣara śriyaḥ

analyzed: caturaśram bhavet bimbam vajra aṅkam pārthivam mahat

analyzed: ardha indu sadṛśam śuklam padma aṅkam payasaḥ smṛtam

analyzed: tri koṇam svastika aṅkam ca raktam taijasam ucyate

original: dhūmraṃ C / omits this line ṣaḍbindusaṃyuktaṃ F / piṇḍasaṃyuktaṃ vṛttaṃ vāyavyamucyate /🔽añjanābhaṃ tathākāśaṃ bimbamātraṃ smṛtaṃ param // //

analyzed: tad ante ca ā c tu mahāpadmam sahasra dala saṃyutam

analyzed: sūrya koṭi sahasra ābham indu koṭi ayuta prabham

analyzed: agnīṣoma maya antaḥsthā mahā ānanda mayī tanuḥ
translated: The body consisting of Agni and Soma, filled with great bliss,

analyzed: anideśya upamā saṃvid mayī sā māmikā parā
translated: That indescribable, consciousness-filled supreme state of mine.

analyzed: ṭippaṇī
translated: Notes

original: dvādaśānteti / mūrdhna upari māyāto dvādaśāṅgulādūrdhvaṃ sthānaṃ dvādaśāntamiti sāṃpradāyiko vyavahāraḥ /

translated: At the end of the twelve, the traditional usage is that the place above the head, twelve finger-breadths above the Māyā, is called the end of the twelve.

original: varṇamayīṃ tanuṃ viśiniṣṭi agnītyādi / dhārāsaṃtāneti / amṛtadhārāsaṃtānarūpetyarthaḥ /
analyzed: varṇa mayīm tanum viśiniṣṭi agni ityādi dhārā saṃtāna iti amṛta dhārā saṃtāna rūpā iti arthaḥ
translated: It distinguishes the body consisting of letters with Agni, etc. The stream of nectar means having the form of the stream of nectar.

original: prakṛtyāḥ sthānamākāśe āha tata iti / mūrdhnaścaturaṅgulordhvabhāge / prakṛtyā avasthānam / tataḥ ṣoḍaśāṅgulopari bhāge avyaktasyāvasthānam /

translated: It says about the place of Prakṛti in space, from that, four finger-breadths above the head, is the location of Prakṛti. From that, in the place sixteen finger-breadths above, is the location of the unmanifest.

original: tata ekādaśāṅgulopari bhāge māyāsthānam / tato dvādaśāṅgulopari bhāge śabdabrahmasthānamiti vivekaḥ / idameva dvadaśāntamityucyate /

translated: From that, in the place eleven finger-breadths above, is the location of Māyā. From that, in the place twelve finger-breadths above, is the location of Śabdabrahman. This is the distinction. This is called the end of the twelve.

analyzed: bimba mātram iti pradhāna ādīnām bimba mātram eva na varṇa ādikam iti arthaḥ
translated: The mere image means that for Pradhana and others, there is only the mere image, not color and so on. This is the meaning.

original: mayi kṣipediti / dehasya dahanacintane tadantaḥsthajīvasyāpi dahanacintanaprasaktau tannivāraṇāya jīvasya devyāṃ nikṣepa ucyate /

translated: He should cast into Me means that when the body is contemplated as being burned, and the living being residing within it is also inclined to be contemplated as being burned, in order to prevent that, the deposition of the living being into the Goddess is stated.

original: tadante dvādaśānte / mahāpadmamiti / astīti śeṣaḥ /🔽p / mūla
analyzed: tad ante dvādaśānte mahāpadmam iti asti iti śeṣaḥ  p mūla
translated: At the end of that, at the end of the twelve, the great lotus, it exists, is the remainder.

analyzed: aṃśataḥ prasaranti asyāḥ jīvānandā saridvarā
translated: The best river of the bliss of the individual self flows from a part of Her.

analyzed: sva ānandam enam ānīya mahānanda mayīm nayet  / tatas lavaṇakūṭa ābham piṇḍam asmad mukha udgataiḥ
translated: Having brought one's own bliss, one should lead to the one full of great bliss.

analyzed: mahā jvālaiḥ mahā vegaiḥ cit mayaiḥ paritas dahet
translated: Then, with the great flames and great speeds born from our mouth, consisting of consciousness, one should completely burn the body that has the form of a salt-hill.

original: tārikānatimadhyastho vijñeyaḥ śāstracakṣuṣā // //🔽somamayyā mamāsyotthaiḥ pīyūṣaiḥ plāvayettataḥ /
analyzed: tārikā nati madhya sthaḥ vijñeyaḥ śāstra cakṣuṣā  soma mayyā mama āsya utthaiḥ pīyūṣaiḥ plāvayet tatas
translated: should be known by the eye of scripture, situated in the middle of the bowing of the moon.🔽Then, with the nectars arisen from my mouth, consisting of the moon, one should flood it.

analyzed: candrī sūkṣmaḥ tu sa vyomā piṇḍasya āpyāyane smṛtaḥ
translated: The moon, subtle, along with the sky, is remembered for nourishing the body.

analyzed: sisṛkṣayā mayā udyatyā saṃvid prāṇa upagūḍhayā
translated: With the desire to create, concealed by the life-breath of consciousness, raised by me,

analyzed: preritāḥ tāḥ smaret śaktīḥ varṇa mayyām mayi sthitāḥ  tatas tābhiḥ sva śaktībhiḥ codanā dvāra pūrvakam pūrvatas  māyā ādi kṣiti paryantam nirmitam saṃsmaret kramāt
translated: I remember the impelled Śaktis residing in me, who am full of letters.🔽Then, by the impulse of those Śaktis, he should remember the creation beginning with Māyā and ending with earth, in the proper order, from the east.

analyzed: tatas piṇḍa samutpattim karaṇa vyañjana ujjvalām
translated: Then, he should remember the origin of the aggregate, shining with the vowels and consonants,

analyzed: evam piṇḍam samutpādya śuddha lakṣmī mayam mahat
translated: Having thus created the aggregate, which is full of pure Lakṣmī,

original: pūrvoktamārgeṇa tato B / pūrvoktena ca mārgeṇa hṛdayaṃ jīvamānayet /
analyzed: pūrva ukta mārgeṇa tatas pūrva uktena ca mārgeṇa hṛdayam jīvam ānayet
translated: Then, by the previously mentioned path, he should bring the living being to the heart.

analyzed: piṇḍa bhūtāḥ trayaḥ varṇāḥ analaḥ soma candriṇau  /
translated: The three letters in the form of the aggregate are Anala (Te), Soma (Va), and Candriṇa (Ya).

analyzed: viśuddha vigrahaḥ tu evam mantra nyāsam samācaret
translated: Thus, one with a pure body should perform the mantra nyāsa.

analyzed: adhikārāya pūjāyām pūjakānām mude api ca
translated: For the sake of authority, for the joy of the worshippers,

original: nibarhaṇāya daityādevighnānāṃ vijayāya ca // //🔽kṣitāvupari vinyastaṃ yat purā phalakādikam /
analyzed: nibarhaṇāya vijayāya ca  kṣitau upari vinyastam yat purā phalaka ādikam
translated: For the destruction of demons and other obstacles, and for victory,🔽The board and other things that were placed on the ground before,

analyzed: svena svena tu mantreṇa tam mantrī tad mantram pañcadhā smaret

analyzed: ādhāra śakti kūrma urvī dugdha abdhi ambuja rūpataḥ
translated: From the supporting power, the tortoise, the earth, the milk ocean, the water, and the lotus,

analyzed: tārkṣyam tatra sthitam dhyāyet kharva bīja ātmanā sthitam

analyzed: tatra upaviśya lakṣmīśam rūpam svam anucintya ca  diśaḥ nibadhya ca astreṇa punar evam muhur muhur
translated: Having sat there, contemplating one's own form as the lord of Lakṣmī,🔽And again and again binding the directions with the weapon,

original: śarajālopamaṃ kṛtvā prākāraṃ cāsanādbahiḥ /🔽saprākāraṃ B / C / satprakāraṃ tu tat sthānaṃ kavacenāvakuṇṭhayet // //

translated: As if invisible to those in the sky, one should perform the nyāsa in this way.🔽Having first performed the nyāsa on the hands, one should perform the nyāsa on the body.

analyzed: ṭippaṇī  asyāḥ mama tanvāḥ

original: jīve dehānnirgamayya dvādaśāntaṃ prāpite sati dehasya dahanacintanamucyate tata ityādinā / lavaṇakūṭābhamiti nirmamitajīvasya dehasya nirdeśaḥ /

original: dāhakāgnimantra ucyate / hrīṃ rthūṃ nama iti /
analyzed: dāhaka agni mantraḥ ucyate hrīṃ rthūm namaḥ iti
translated: The mantra for the burning fire is said to be Hrim Rhum Namah.

original: punaḥ aprākṛtadehasaṃpatticintanamāha somamayyā iti / tatra mantraḥ ṭyaṃ iti / jayākhye tu vsaṃ ityuktaḥ /

original: māyā pradhānasya susūkṣmāvasthā yāṃ tama ityaupaniṣadā vadanti /
analyzed: māyā pradhānasya su sūkṣma avasthā yām tamaḥ iti aupaniṣadāḥ vadanti
translated: Maya is the extremely subtle state of the prakriti, which the Upanishad-knowers call tamas.

original: jīvamantramāha piṇḍabhūtā iti / rṭsa iti jātaḥ / jayākhye'pyevamevoktaḥ /
analyzed: jīva mantram āha piṇḍa bhūtāḥ iti iti jātaḥ jaya ākhye pi evam eva uktaḥ

analyzed: kharva bījam iti kham iti ākārakam iti arthaḥ
translated: The seed of Kham means having the form of Kham.

original: svaṃ rūpamiti / ātmeti tūpagacchanti ityuktarītyā svātmakamityarthaḥ /
analyzed: svam rūpam iti ātmā iti tu upagacchanti iti ukta rītyā sva ātmakam iti arthaḥ
translated: One's own form means having one's own self, in the sense stated as but they call it the self.
